description.head: The binary addition can overflow.
description.tail: The operands of the addition operation are not sufficiently constrained. The addition could therefore result in an integer overflow. Prevent the overflow by checking inputs or ensure sure that the overflow is caught by an assertion.

description.head: persistent state read after call

description.head: A reachable exception has been detected.
description.tail: It is possible to trigger an exception (opcode 0xfe). Exceptions can be caused by type errors, division by zero, out-of-bounds array access, or assert violations. Note that explicit `assert()` should only be used to check invariants. Use `require()` for regular input checking.

description.head: A reachable exception has been detected.
description.tail: It is possible to trigger an exception (opcode 0xfe). Exceptions can be caused by type errors, division by zero, out-of-bounds array access, or assert violations. Note that explicit `assert()` should only be used to check invariants. Use `require()` for regular input checking.

description.head: Potential denial-of-service if block gas limit is reached.
description.tail: A storage modification is executed in a loop. Be aware that the transaction may fail to execute if the loop is unbounded and the necessary gas exceeds the block gas limit.
